public abstract class zeta.util.DebugWriter

(source file: DebugWriter.pizza)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.util.DebugWriter
The pure class interface. 
public abstract class DebugWriter
A class for managing debug prints.

Provides several methods for convenient printing of debug messages. By default, debug messages are send to standard error. It is possible to statically configure another output channel or a session to receive the debug messages.

Debug printing itself is done on an instance of a DebugWriter -- when creating such an instance, it is decided on base of a parameter whether debug prints are actually done or not.

Typical usage is as follows: 

 class MyClass {
   static DebugWriter debug = 
      DebugWriter.make(toolName,"debug.MyClass");

   .... {
      debug.send("reaching foo");
      ...
      debug.send("reaching bar");
      ...
   }
 }

Version: $Id: DebugWriter.pizza,v 1.2 1998/09/13 15:09:16 wg Exp $

DebugWriter
public DebugWriter();

setReceiver
public static void setReceiver(PrintWriter writer);
Set the given print-writer to be used for all debug messages. An older print-writer or session is overwritten as a receiver.

setReceiver

public static void setReceiver(Session session);
Set the given session to be used for all debug messages. An older print-writer or session system is overwritten as a receiver.

make

public static DebugWriter make(Name name,
                               boolean active);
Return an instance of a debug writer, using the given tool name in session messages. If the given boolean is true, then the returned debug writer will issue its messages to the currently configured receiver. Otherwise all output to the returned debug writer will be ignored.

make

public static DebugWriter make(Name name,
                               String property);
Return an instance of a debug writer, using the given tool name in session messages. If the given property string is defined in the system property set, then the returned debug writer will issue its messages to the currently configured receiver. Otherwise all output to the returned debug writer will be ignored.

send

public abstract void send(String message);
Send the given string to this debug printer.

send

public abstract void send(Format format);
Send the given format to this debug printer.

send

public abstract void send(String message,
                          Object object);
Send the given string and the given object to this debug printer. If this is an active printer, the object will be formatted for printing using the generic format method.

See also:
Format.buildFormat

send

public abstract void send(String message,
                          Object object1,
                          Object object2);
Send the given string and the given two objects to this debug printer. If this is an active printer, the object will be formatted for printing using the generic format method.

See also:
Format.buildFormat

send

public abstract void send(String message,
                          Object object1,
                          Object object2,
                          Object object3);
Send the given string and the given three objects to this debug printer. If this is an active printer, the object will be formatted for printing using the generic format method.

See also:
Format.buildFormat

isActive

public abstract boolean isActive();
Return true if this is an active debug writer.
